did.head: DESCRIPTIVE SUMMARY
did.physdesc: Galley proofs, photographs, correspondence, subject files, metal-etched blocks.
did.repository: Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library
did.abstract: The collection contains galley proofs including original drawings for publications, photographs, subject files, course files, correspondence, notebooks, field books, and metal-etched blocks used in illustrations used in publications.

bioghist.head: BIOGRAPHICAL NOTE
bioghist.p: Professor Brown taught entomology and evolutionary theory in the Department of Entomology in the New York State College of Agriculture and Life Sciences at Cornell University from 1960 until his retirement in 1991. He worked on the reclassification of the family Formicidae, the ant. Before coming to Cornell, he worked with all of the principal museum ant collections in North and South America, Western Europe, South Africa and Australia.

scopecontent.head: COLLECTION DESCRIPTION
scopecontent.p: The collection contains galley proofs including original drawings for publications, photographs, subject files, course files, correspondence, notebooks, field books, and metal-etched blocks used in illustrations used in publications.

prefercite.head: Cite As:
prefercite.p: William L. Brown, Jr. papers, #21-01-3532. Division of Rare and Manuscript Collections, Cornell University Library.

arrangement.head: SERIES LIST
arrangement.p:
Series I. Personal-Correspondence, CV, Publications
Box 1

Series II. Drawings, Galleys, Photocopies, Photographs, Scanning Electron Microscope (SEM) Shots
Boxes 1, 2

Series IV. Pilot Register of Zoology (PRZ)
Box 2

Series V. National Science Foundation (NSF) Grants
Box 2

Series VII. Manuscripts, Notes, Maps, Articles, Reprints, Correspondence, Studies and Data
Box 4

Series VIII. Administrative Records, Committee Reports
Box 4

Series X. Karyotypes and Printing Materials
Box 5

Series XII. Oversize Galley Proofs
Boxes 7-9

Series X. Karyotypes and Printing Materials
Contains: 1 Index Card Box and I Envelope of Karyotypes, 3 Envelopes of Etched Metal Plates, and 4 Wood Blocks
